member.name: T:Amazon.AppStream.Model.DescribeSessionsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeSessions operation. Describes the streaming sessions for a stack and a fleet. If a user ID is provided, this operation returns streaming sessions for only that user. Pass this value for the nextToken parameter in a subsequent call to this operation to retrieve the next set of items. If an authentication type is not provided, the operation defaults to users authenticated using a streaming URL.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppStream.Model.DescribeSessionsRequest.AuthenticationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationType.
The authentication method of the user. It can be API for a user authenticated using a streaming URL, or SAML for a SAML federated user. If an authentication type is not provided, the operation defaults to users authenticated using a streaming URL.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppStream.Model.DescribeSessionsRequest.FleetName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FleetName.
The name of the fleet for which to list sessions.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppStream.Model.DescribeSessionsRequest.Limit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Limit.
The size of each page of results. The default value is 20 and the maximum supported value is 50.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppStream.Model.DescribeSessionsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:

The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.AppStream.Model.UpdateFleetRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateFleet operation. Updates an existing fleet. All the attributes except the fleet name can be updated in the STOPPED state. When a fleet is in the RUNNING state, only DisplayName and ComputeCapacity can be updated. A fleet cannot be updated in a status of STARTING or STOPPING.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppStream.Model.UpdateFleetRequest.DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DisconnectTimeoutInSeconds.
The time after disconnection when a session is considered to have ended. If a user who got disconnected reconnects within this timeout interval, the user is connected back to their previous session. The input can be any numeric value in seconds between 60 and 57600.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppStream.AmazonAppStreamClient

Implementation for accessing AppStream
Amazon AppStream 2.0

member.name: M:Amazon.AppStream.AmazonAppStreamClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonAppStreamClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.AppStream.AmazonAppStreamClient.DescribeSessions(Amazon.AppStream.Model.DescribeSessionsRequest)
member.summary: Describes the streaming sessions for a stack and a fleet. If a user ID is provided, this operation returns streaming sessions for only that user. Pass this value for the nextToken parameter in a subsequent call to this operation to retrieve the next set of items. If an authentication type is not provided, the operation defaults to users authenticated using a streaming URL.

A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
